reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project's aim is to improve the food and nutrition security of households and to protect and help restore biodiversity in the implementation areas by the application of farmer managed natural regeneration (FMNR) method. FMNR will be applied by forest c ooperatives. As part of the process of establishing legal forest cooperatives, several activities will be carried out such as delineation of communal land, bylaw development, mapping, land certification and capacity building. This approach has been tested in many other areas in the country, specifically within the same zone in the neighbouring districts like Humbo and Soddo and is seen as the best method to scale up agroforestry and reforestation activities in Ethiopia. The communities in the project site a re well informed and have good awareness on the benefits of FMNR practices which will ease the project implementation. Communities and local government staff will implement the project while WVE staff will take a supportive (technical and material) role an d provide some level of facilitation. Although all community members in and around the project area are expected to benefit from the project, specific attention will be given to the most vulnerable families and their children, landless youths as well as fe male-headed households. The project has approximately 14 000 direct beneficiary households in the Wolaita and West Arsi Zones. The main partner is in project implementation is World Vision Ethiopia.
